intro: Lapsana koelpinia, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has alternate, hairy, and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in flat-topped clusters, attracting various pollinators. Lapsana koelpinia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
